_prev_prog_2.EquipmentTested: Nurse tanks, Storage tanks, valves, pumps, hoses

_exec_summary.SummaryText:
ACCIDENTAL RELEASE PREVENTION/EMERGENCY RESPONSE AT NORTHERN AG SERVICE, INC., 105 Armour ST., West Union, IA.

Northern Ag Service, Inc. complies with ANSI Standards for Anhydrous Ammonia storage.  It is our policy to adhere to all applicable Federal, State, and local regulations.  If an emergency were to occur, it is our policy to immediately notify the local Fire Department (a 911 call) and request a response to the emergency.  This call would also notify the FayetteCounty Sheriff's office.  A follow up call would be made to the office of the County LEPC.  A real emergency  would be unexpected and may be very different in nature from any training in the past.  However, any previous planning/training  will serve as guidelines to follow.

The primary emergency coordinator is Adam Keller.  His work and 24 hr. Emergency number is listed in the Registration Section of this document.  Additional contacts are listed below in order:

     Adam Keller, Location Manager
        Work: (563) 422-6281      24 hr. (563) 422-7702

     Andy Larson, Maint.
        Work: (563) 380-5401 24 hr. (563) 380-5401

     Curt Strong
        Work: (563)422-6281      24 hr. (563) 880-2870

DESCRIPTION OF THE ANHYDROUS AMMONIA STORAGE/DISTRIBUTION PLANT AND THE REGULATED SUBSTANCE HANDLED AT NORTHERN AG SERVICE, INC., McGREGOR, IA.

  The anhydrous ammonia that is stored at this facility is distributed to agricultural crop producers in the surrounding area who utilize the anhydrous ammonia for crop nutrient purposes.

The system consists of a storage tank with associated piping, valves, etc., as well as portable tank units.  The anhydrous ammonia plant is operated on a seasonal basis (Spring and Fall).

GENERAL ACCIDENTAL RELEASE PREVENTION PROGRAM AND CHEMICAL-SPECIFIC PREVENTION STEPS:

This facility complies with EPA, State, and local codes and regulations.  The anhydrous ammonia system is designed , installed, and maintained in accordance with ANSI Standards and State law.

In addition,

the company has specific operating procedures in place intended to minimize the potential for an accidental release of anhydrous ammonia.

FIVE YEAR ACCIDENT HISTORY:

Northern Ag Service, Inc., West Union, IA, has not experienced accidental release involving anhydrous ammonia in the last (5) years that caused death, injuries, evacuations, property or environmental damage.

THE EMERGENCY RESPONSE PROGRAM:

In the event of an emergency involving our anhydrous ammonia system, it is the policy of Northern Ag Service, Inc., to immediately contact the local Emergency Responders ( fire dept., county sheriff, local police, and county LEPC ) with a 911 call.  Members of the local fire and law enforcement departments are encouraged to become familiar with our location and facilities, enabling them to more quickly assess and necessary response procedures.

PLANNED CHANGES TO IMPROVE SAFETY:

Our overall plan to minimize hazards to human health and to the environment that are associated with accidental releases of anhydorus ammonia.  Employees working with the anhydorus ammonia system make routine observations and inspections prior to and during transfer operations of the anhydrous ammonia from the storage tank to nurse tanks, enabling them to detect problems early before they can cause a hazardous situation.  Employees are trained to recognize areas of potential hazards and new hires are trained immediately and observed to determine their level of comprehension and understanding.  The company makes every effort to cooperate with local, state, and federal officials as they endeavor to assist us with our anhydrous ammonia operation.
